column4: Quick question.. when you exit X-Windows, does the terminal that you drop down to have a name?
I know it runs bash, but as for the terminal itself.. for example, in xwindows, you have rxvt, etc.
don't have a linux box on my at the moment though, chatting from a windows client. :(
I think the program that prompts you for password is called "login", the program that handles alt-f1 -> alt-f7 is getty
ah, i see! thanks! i'll google 'getty'
I think droopsta915 is talking about the IDE cables.
you do realize that both of them are not "terminals". :P
ah, i just wasn't sure what to call it. heh
last time there was mgetty, then agetty, I don' t know which one we are using now.
so what would be controlling the video i/o for the terminal?
maybe I can help more if you tell me what you are trying to acomplish?
well, not really trying to accomplish anything really, lol. just curious.
like when you hit alt-f1 to alt-f7, what are those instances of?
i know rxvt, you can have 7 windows, etc.
ah ok, getty is the one that handles the alt-f1 -> alt-f7, getty launches the "login" program.
you can look into /etc/inittab, there should be some getty stuffs in there.
